column4: how can I get syntax highlighting for vim. I have installed vim.python, done touch .vimrc and put "syntax enable" in it.
sudo apt-get install vim-full
that will enable syntax-highlighting but installing only vim.python won't ?
I installed vim-full but I still don
one min
any progress with syntax highlighting on vim?
are you gutsy?
incase you are still here, you have to edit /etc/vimrc and uncomment syntax on
no its not, just goto launchpad.net and register
I did that.
then goto wiki.ubuntu.com and login using that account

by default it will create your wiki page using your registered name, if you want your wiki page to have a different title, goto your account settings in launchpad (click at your name on the upper right corner) and change the Wiki Name
is there a special editor I can use without having to type "==##==' and the like myself ?
sorry? editor for what?
i am sorry, i don't understand, tags for what?
formatting. like title 1 etc. I want to avoid typing those myself.
oh in wiki.ubuntu.com! unfortunately no
doesn't launchpad use darcs ?
not sure, it does use some revision control
i am relatively new to coding procedures. putting my code up on launchpad seems to be a hassle. can you tell me where I can start?
have you checked https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HelpOnEditing
